item.title: 中东担忧缓解，亚洲股市上扬，石油和黄金回落
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市收复部分失地，债券收益率上升，原因是对中东冲突扩大的担忧减弱，投资者重新转向风险较高的资产。【原文：Asian stocks recovered some losses on Monday and bond yields rose as fears of a wider Middle East conflict ebbed, with investors gravitating back towards riskier assets.】

item.title: 腾讯时隔七年将于五月发布《地下城与勇士》手机游戏
item.description: 中国科技巨头腾讯控股周一表示，经过七年的开发，它将于 5 月 21 日发布备受期待的《地下城与勇士》手机游戏。【原文：Chinese tech giant Tencent Holdings said on Monday that it will release its much-anticipated "Dungeon and Fighter" mobile game on May 21 after seven years of development.】

item.title: 麦格理银行部门停止新增汽车贷款，专注于房贷增长
item.description: 澳大利亚金融企业集团麦格理集团（Macquarie Group）周一表示，其银行和金融服务部门将停止通过直接、中介和委托租赁渠道发放新的汽车贷款，以优先发展住房贷款和存款业务。【原文：Australian financial conglomerate Macquarie Group said on Monday its banking and financial services unit will stop new car loans through direct, broker and novated lease channels in a bid to prioritise growth of home loan and deposit offerings.】

item.title: 激烈竞争导致盈利前景下调，新西兰航空股价下跌
item.description: 新西兰航空公司周一下调了年度盈利预期，理由是经济逆风和生活成本危机导致国内和北美市场的收入疲软，从而使该航空公司的股价跌至近两年的低点。【原文：Air New Zealand trimmed its annual earnings estimates on Monday, citing economic headwinds and a cost-of-living crisis leading to softer revenue in domestic and North American markets, sending the carrier's shares to a near two-year low.】

item.title: 中国比亚迪将电动皮卡命名为 "比亚迪鲨鱼
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪周一表示，其电动皮卡将被命名为 "比亚迪鲨鱼"，并将配备一套名为 "双模式越野"（DMO）的插电式混合动力系统。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD said on Monday its electric pickup truck will be called BYD Shark and will feature a plug-in hybrid system called Dual Mode Off-Road (DMO), which it developed for improving off-road driving experiences.】

item.title: 疲惫的一周过后，货币平静而谨慎
item.description: 欧元和日元在周一的亚洲早盘交易中相对稳定，美元在上周紧张的政策和地缘政治发展之后维持在高位附近。【原文：The euro and yen were relatively steady in early Asian trading on Monday and the U.S. dollar stayed near its highs after last week's hectic policy and geopolitical developments.】

item.title: 美国原油库存增加，降息担忧凸显，油价回落
item.description: 周一亚洲开盘时，油价下跌，受市场重新关注基本面的拖累，以色列和伊朗在以色列对伊朗发动明显的小规模打击后，淡化了中东敌对行动升级的风险。【原文：Oil prices fell at Asia's open on Monday, dragged down by a renewed focus on market fundamentals, as Israel and Iran played down the risks of an escalation of hostilities in the Middle East after Israel's apparently small strike on Iran.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：Salesforce 收购 Informatica 的谈判告吹
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周日援引知情人士的话报道，客户关系软件制造商 Salesforce 与数据管理软件公司 Informatica 之间的谈判因双方无法就条款达成一致而失败。【原文：Talks between customer relations software maker Salesforce and data-management software firm Informatica have failed after the companies could not agree on terms, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚财政部长称中东紧张局势加剧全球经济担忧
item.description: 澳大利亚财政部长周一警告说，中东事件加剧了人们对全球经济的担忧，并将影响政府五月份的预算，其主要贸易伙伴的近期展望也将下调。【原文：Australia's treasurer warned on Monday that events in the Middle East are fueling concerns for the global economy and will shape the government's budget in May, with near-term outlook downgrades for its major trading partners.】

item.title: 美国商务部长淡化先进的华为手机芯片
item.description: 美国商务部长吉娜-雷蒙多（Gina Raimondo）周日表示，为受制裁的中国公司华为的 Mate 60 Pro 手机提供动力的芯片不如美国芯片先进，并认为这表明美国遏制向这家电信设备巨头发货的措施正在发挥作用。【原文：The chip powering the Mate 60 Pro phone of sanctioned Chinese company Huawei is not as advanced as American chips, U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said on Sunday, arguing that it shows U.S. curbs on shipments to the telecoms equipment giant are working.】

item.title: Rightmove 称英国住宅要价接近历史最高水平
item.description: 据一项行业调查显示，2024 年初的房市势头延续到了 4 月份，在创下一年来最大年度涨幅之后，英国的房屋销售价格已接近历史最高点。【原文：Prices of homes being sold in Britain are close to their record highs after the biggest annual increase in a year, according to an industry survey that suggested the momentum in the housing market of early 2024 extended into April.】

item.title: 早间竞价：脆弱的外汇市场和科技股暴跌为市场情绪蒙上阴影
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称中东紧张局势不应推迟欧洲央行 6 月降息
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）周日表示，中东地区的紧张局势不太可能推动能源价格上涨，也不应影响欧洲央行6月份开始降息的计划。【原文：Tension in the Middle East is unlikely to drive up energy prices and should not affect the European Central Bank's plans to start cutting interest rates in June, French central bank chief Francois Villeroy de Galhau said on Sunday.】

item.title: 葡萄牙 Galp 公司称纳米比亚附近油田可能蕴藏 100 亿桶石油
item.description: 葡萄牙石油公司Galp Energia周日表示，该公司已完成纳米比亚沿海莫帕内油田的第一阶段勘探工作，估计该油田至少可开采100亿桶石油。【原文：Portuguese oil company Galp Energia said on Sunday it had concluded the first phase of exploration in the Mopane field off the coast of Namibia and estimated it could have at least 10 billion barrels of oil.】

item.title: CNH 选中依维柯集团的马克思为新任首席执行官
item.description: 意大利阿涅利家族的控股公司对旗下两大工业集团的高层进行了调整，斯科特-怀恩（Scott Wine）辞去了农用和建筑机械集团 CNH 首席执行官的职务，由依维柯公司的老板格利特-马克思（Gerrit Marx）接任。【原文：The holding company of Italy's Agnelli family has overseen a shakeup at the top of two of its major industrial groups, with Scott Wine quitting his post as CEO of farm and construction machinery group CNH to be replaced by Iveco boss Gerrit Marx.】

item.title: 特斯拉下调德国和欧洲部分车型价格
item.description: 特斯拉公司发言人周日表示，特斯拉将在德国以及欧洲、中东和非洲其他地区下调部分车型的价格。【原文：Tesla is cutting prices of some models in Germany and elsewhere in Europe, the Middle East and Africa, a spokesperson said on Sunday.】

item.title: SonntagsZeitung》称瑞银将于 6 月开始五次裁员潮
item.description: 据《星期日报》（SonntagsZeitung）周日报道，瑞士银行业巨头瑞银集团（UBS）在收购瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse）后宣布削减成本计划，裁员将从今年 6 月开始分五波进行。【原文：Layoffs under Swiss banking giant UBS's cost-cutting programme announced after its takeover of Credit Suisse will take place in five waves this year starting in June, newspaper SonntagsZeitung reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 特斯拉将全自动驾驶软件的价格降低三分之一，降至 8,000 美元
item.description: 特斯拉网站周六显示，特斯拉全自动驾驶辅助软件在美国的售价从1.2万美元降至8000美元。【原文：Tesla slashed the price of its Full Self-Driving driver assistant software to $8,000 from $12,000 in the United States, its website showed on Saturday.】

item.title: 美国降价后，特斯拉在中国、德国及全球降价
item.description: 特斯拉在美国降价后，又在包括中国和德国在内的一些主要市场降价，以应对销量下滑和愈演愈烈的电动汽车（EV）价格战，特别是与价格更低的中国电动汽车的竞争。【原文：Tesla has cut prices in a number of its major markets - including in China and Germany - after price cuts in the United States - as it grapples with falling sales and an intensifying price war for electric vehicles (EVs), especially against cheaper Chinese EVs.】

item.title: 多边开发银行希望在 10 年内增加多达 4000 亿美元的贷款
item.description: 美洲开发银行周六表示，10 家多边开发银行的领导人承诺在五个关键领域采取行动，包括在未来十年内提供总额达 3,000-4,000 亿美元的额外贷款。【原文：The Inter-American Development Bank on Saturday said leaders of 10 multilateral development banks committed to take action in five critical areas, including additional lending headroom totaling $300-400 billion over the next decade.】

item.title: 瑞士国家银行行长称增长过低，但必须关注物价稳定
item.description: 瑞士国家银行行长托马斯-乔丹（Thomas Jordan）在周六播出的讲话中表示，货币政策应继续关注物价稳定。【原文：Monetary policy should remain focused on price stability, Swiss National Bank Chairman Thomas Jordan said in remarks aired on Saturday.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）的戈皮纳特说美国的高需求推动了经济增长和利率上升
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）第一副总裁吉塔-戈皮纳特（Gita Gopinath）周六表示，美国需要增加收入以降低高额预算赤字，尽管这些赤字正在通过刺激美国国内需求来推动全球经济增长。【原文：The United States needs to raise revenues to bring down high budget deficits even though they are helping to fuel global growth by stoking domestic U.S. demand, International Monetary Fund First Deputy Managing Director Gita Gopinath said on Saturday.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织和世界银行指导委员会强调改革推进过程中的问责制
item.description: 国际货币基金组织和世界银行的指导委员会周六强调，在这两个机构实施改革以帮助各国应对气候变化和其他冲击的过程中，需要建立更广泛的问责制。【原文：The steering committee for both International Monetary Fund and the World Bank on Saturday emphasized the need for broader accountability as the institutions implemented reforms to help countries grapple with climate change and other shocks.】

item.title: 大众工厂获胜后，UAW 将目光投向阿拉巴马州的奔驰工厂
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers）在美国南部的一家汽车厂赢得了首次工会投票，创造了历史。现在，它需要在下个月于阿拉巴马州的梅赛德斯工厂取得第二次胜利，以证明这一成功并非侥幸。【原文：The United Auto Workers has made history by winning its first unionization vote at an auto factory in the U.S. South. Now it needs to prove the success wasn't a fluke by pulling off a second victory at a Mercedes plant in Alabama next month.】

item.title: 迪拜洪灾后阿联酋航空和迪拜国际航空恢复正常运营
item.description: 迪拜旗舰航空公司阿联酋航空（Emirates）和姊妹航空公司迪拜国际航空（flydubai）周六表示，在本周早些时候暴雨导致阿联酋各地发生严重洪灾后，两家航空公司已恢复正常运营。【原文：Dubai's flagship carrier Emirates and sister airline flydubai have restored normal operations after heavy rains caused severe flooding across the United Arab Emirates earlier this week, the airlines said on Saturday.】

item.title: X 誓言 "强烈质疑 "澳大利亚删除刺伤帖子的命令
item.description: 社交媒体平台 X 周六表示，它将在法庭上对澳大利亚监管机构要求该公司删除一些与悉尼一名主教被刺事件有关的帖子的命令提出质疑。【原文：Social media platform X said on Saturday it would challenge in court an order from an Australian regulator demanding the company remove some posts related to the stabbing of a bishop in Sydney.】

item.title: 特斯拉将 Y、X 和 S 车型的美国售价下调 2000 美元
item.description: 特斯拉周五将其 Model Y、Model X 和 Model S 汽车在美国的售价各下调 2000 美元，几天前这家全球最有价值汽车制造商的第一季度交付量未能达到市场预期。【原文：Tesla cut the U.S. prices of its Model Y, Model X and Model S vehicles by $2,000 each on Friday, days after the first-quarter deliveries of the world's most valuable automaker missed market expectations.】

item.title: UAW 在大众田纳西工厂取得分水岭式的工会胜利
item.description: 大众汽车田纳西州工厂的工人已投票决定加入美国汽车工人工会，该工会周五表示，在非官方统计结果显示大多数符合条件的工人投票支持加入工会后，该工厂取得了胜利。【原文：Workers at Volkswagen's Tennessee plant have voted to join the United Auto Workers, the union said on Friday, calling victory after an unofficial tally showed a majority of eligible workers had cast ballots in favor of the union.】

item.title: 日本央行上田表示，如果通胀持续上升，"很有可能 "加息
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫周五表示，如果基本通胀率继续上升，央行将 "很有可能 "提高利率。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Friday the central bank will "very likely" be raising interest rates if underlying inflation continued to go up.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司第一季度交付 25 架喷气机，积压量创 7 年新高
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）周五表示，该公司在2024年第一季度交付了25架飞机，其中包括7架商用飞机和18架公务机，同比增长67%。【原文：Brazilian planemaker Embraer said on Friday it delivered 25 aircraft - seven commercial planes and 18 executive jets - in the first quarter of 2024, a 67% increase on a yearly basis.】
